'Lyxose' is an aldopentose â€” a monosaccharide containing five carbon
atoms, and including an aldehyde functional group. It has chemical formula
5 10 5. It is a C'-2 carbon epimer of the
sugar Xylose.

Lyxose occurs only rarely in nature, for example, as a component of bacterial
glycolipids. Kay-Hooi Khoo et al., Chemistry of the Lyxose-
Containing Mycobacteriophage Receptors of Mycobacterium phlei/Mycobacterium
smegmatis, Biochemistry, 35 (36), 11812-11819, 1996. [http://pubs.acs.org/cgi-
bin/abstract.cgi/bichaw/1996/35/i36/abs/bi961055+.html Abstract]
